Low density residential background. | caption2 = Station location looking north }} '''Waratah Mills MLR station''' is a planned light rail stop on the [[Metro Light Rail]] line in [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]] serving the suburb of [[Dulwich Hill, New South Wales|Dulwich Hill]]. Access will be gained via Davis Street and via the Green Way path, a planned pedestrian and cycleway that will commence at the Cooks River in [[Dulwich Hill]], and follow the light rail corridor through to [[Iron Cove]]. Completion of the project is expected to be in 2012 and is a part of the State Government's two-stage $500 million light rail expansion plan that makes use of the former Rozelle branch of the [[Metropolitan Goods railway line]] heavy rail freight corridor. The extension will operate from the current light rail terminus at [[Lilyfield MLR station|Lilyfield]] to [[Dulwich Hill Interchange MLR station|Dulwich Hill]].http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/rail/lightrail-extension.htmlhttp://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/file/rail/SLRE-Community-Update-July-August-2010.pdfhttp://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/file/rail/SLRE-Community-Update-July-August-2010.pdf The stop's name is a reference to the former Waratah Mills flour mill located on the opposite side of Davis Street.[http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/files/publications/SLRE-Preliminary-Environmental-Assessment.pdf Sydney Light Rail Extension - Stage 1 - Inner West Extension - Preliminary Environmental Assessment.] Appendix A. Transport NSW. The mill has been converted to apartments and is a local landmark. The stop is estimated to be used by 225 boarding passengers per weekday by 2016.[http://majorprojects.planning.nsw.gov.au/files/61649/08_Environmental%20Assessment%20-%20Volume%201%20-%20Part%20C1%20-%20Chapter%2010.pdf Environmental Assessment - Volume 1 - Part C1 - Chapter 10.] Table 10.1 p 201.
